John Stercke († 5 April 1532) of Meerbeke, 14 ms. W. of Brussels, was Rector of St. Donatian’s college at Louvain in June 1517, when Busleiden named him as a trustee for the execution of his will founding the Collegium trilingue. He was selected as first Presidont of the new college, and held the office till 1526, when he retired into private life. See Neve, pp. 387—8, giving the inscription on his tomb in St. Martin⁷s church at Louvain.
